>>>>>> INPUT >>>>>

---
EXERCISE "My Random Multiple Choice Exercise"
@code
let x = rand(1, 5)
let y = rand(1, 5)
let b = x > y
@text
[$b$] check this if $ x > y $
[ ] an incorrect answer
Second multiple choice:
[x] correct
[ ] incorrect
---

>>>>>> OUTPUT >>>>>

"exercise": {
  "title": "My Random Multiple Choice Exercise",
  "code_raw": "let x = rand(1, 5)\nlet y = rand(1, 5)\nlet b = x > y\n",
  "variables": [
    {"name": "x", "type": "real", "values": [2, 4, 1, 2]},
    {"name": "y", "type": "real", "values": [1, 2, 3, 2]},
    {"name": "b", "type": "bool", "values": [true, true, false, false]},
    {"name": "mc0", "type": "bool", "values": [true, true, false, false]},
    {"name": "mc1", "type": "bool", "values": [false, false, false, false]},
    {"name": "mc2", "type": "bool", "values": [true, true, true, true]},
    {"name": "mc3", "type": "bool", "values": [false, false, false, false]},
  ]
  "text_raw": "[$b$] check...",
  "text": [
     { "type": "multi_choice", "items": [
       { "variable": "mc0", "text": [
         {"type": "string", "value": "check this if "},
         {"type"; "math": "value": "$x$ > $y$"}]}
     ] }
  ]
}

>>>>>
"*_raw" is NOT present in final output; just used to detect changes
>>>>>
